means: 拉( pull的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He got out of bed and pulled on his bathrobe.
I shivered and pulled my scarf more tightly round my neck.
sentence.Network_cn: 我打了个寒战，用围巾把脖子围得更紧了。

sentence.Network_en: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentence.Network_cn: 1941年，火车本可以由蒸汽机车拉动。

He fished in and pulled out some fresh sticks that were sold at the time ., 他伸手在上衣袋里摸一摸 , 掏出了几枝当时在街上叫卖的新鲜甘草.

entry.def: When you pull something, you hold it firmly and use force in order to move it towards you  or away from its previous position.

example.ex: They have pulled out patients' teeth unnecessarily...
example.tran: 他们毫无必要地拔掉了病人的牙。

example.ex: He pulled on a jersey...
example.tran: 他套上一件运动衫。

entry.def: When you pull an object from a bag, pocket, or cupboard, you put your hand in and bring the object out.

example.ex: Jack pulled the slip of paper from his shirt pocket...
example.tran: 杰克从衬衫口袋里抽出这张纸条。

example.ex: Wade walked quickly to the refrigerator and pulled out another beer.
example.tran: 韦德快步走到冰箱边又拿出一罐啤酒。

entry.def: When a vehicle, animal, or person pulls a cart or piece of machinery, they are attached to it or hold it, so that it moves along behind them when they move forward.

example.ex: This is early-20th-century rural Sussex, when horses still pulled the plough...
example.tran: 这是20世纪早期的萨塞克斯乡村，那时还是用马拉犁。

example.ex: He pulls a rickshaw, probably the oldest form of human taxi service.
example.tran: 他拉黄包车，这可能是人类最古老的载客服务形式了。

entry.def: If you pull yourself or pull a part of your body in a particular direction, you move your body or a part of your body with effort or force.

example.ex: Hughes pulled himself slowly to his feet...
example.tran: 休斯慢慢站了起来。

example.ex: He pulled his arms out of the sleeves...
example.tran: 他把胳膊从袖子里抽出来。

entry.def: When a driver or vehicle pulls to a stop or a halt, the vehicle stops.

example.ex: He pulled to a stop behind a pickup truck...
example.tran: 他在一辆皮卡货车后面停了下来。

example.ex: The train pulled to a halt at the platform.
example.tran: 火车在站台边停下。

entry.def: In a race or contest, if you pull ahead of or pull away from an opponent, you gradually increase the amount by which you are ahead of them.

example.ex: He pulled away, extending his lead to 15 seconds...
example.tran: 他把领先优势逐渐扩大到了15秒。

example.ex: The six states he won in 1988 are the same states in which he has yet to pull ahead of his opponent.
example.tran: 1988年他获胜的6个州也是他目前有待领先于对手的几个州。

entry.def: If you pull something apart, you break or divide it into small pieces, often in order to put them back together again in a different way.

example.ex: If I wanted to improve the car significantly I would have to pull it apart and start again.
example.tran: 如果想好好地改进这辆车，我将不得不把它拆开重装。

entry.def: If someone pulls a gun or a knife on someone else, they take out a gun or knife and threaten the other person with it.

example.ex: They had a fight. One of them pulled a gun on the other...
example.tran: 他们打了起来。其中一人拔出枪指着另一个人。

example.ex: I pulled a knife and threatened her.
example.tran: 我拔出刀威胁她。

entry.tran: 吸引，拉拢（人群、观众或选民）
entry.def: To pull crowds, viewers, or voters means to attract them.

example.ex: The organisers have to employ performers to pull a crowd.
example.tran: 组织者不得不雇些演员来聚拢人气。

entry.def: If something pulls you or pulls your thoughts or feelings in a particular direction, it strongly attracts you or influences you in a particular way.

example.ex: Joe felt there was little he could do to help Betty, and his heart was pulling him elsewhere.
example.tran: 乔感到帮不上贝蒂什么忙，他的心思在别的地方。

entry.def: A pull is a strong physical force which causes things to move in a particular direction.

example.ex: ...the pull of gravity.
example.tran: 重力的牵引

entry.def: If you are pulling for someone, you support and encourage them, especially in a competition.

example.ex: We're all pulling for each other because we're desperate to win the Cup back...
example.tran: 因为我们非常想赢回奖杯，所以一直在互相打气。

example.ex: You know I've been pulling for you.
example.tran: 你知道我一直在为你加油。

entry.def: If you pull a muscle, you injure it by straining it.

example.ex: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball...
example.tran: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

example.ex: He suffered a pulled calf muscle.
example.tran: 他小腿肚肌肉拉伤。

entry.def: If someone pulls on a cigarette, they take a deep breath with the cigarette in their mouth.

example.ex: Jeff leaned back and pulled on his cigarette.
example.tran: 杰夫往后一靠，深深地吸了一口烟。

entry.def: To pull a stunt or a trick on someone means to do something dramatic or silly in order to get their attention or trick them.

example.ex: Everyone saw the stunt you pulled on me.
example.tran: 大家都看见了你对我耍的花招。

entry.def: If someone pulls someone else, they succeed in attracting them sexually and in spending the rest of the evening or night with them.
You can say to someone 'Pull the other one' or 'Pull the other one, it's got bells on' to tell them that you do not believe what they have told you and you think they must be joking.

example.ex: What! A big bloke like you, beaten by his wife! Pull the other one; it's got bells on.
example.tran: 什么！你这么一个大块头居然被他的妻子打了！别逗了。

means.word_mean: 1. drawn toward the source of the force;

sentences.sentence: "this exercise must be done with the arms pulled back"

auth_sentence.content: I followed a black car and he pulled across.
auth_sentence.res_content: I followed a black car and he pulled across.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I followed a black car and he pulled across.

auth_sentence.content: The witness says the soldier then pulled the trigger.
auth_sentence.res_content: The witness says the soldier then pulled the trigger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The witness says the soldier then pulled the trigger.

auth_sentence.content: Ultimately, Syria pulled its troops out of Lebanon.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ultimately, Syria pulled its troops out of Lebanon.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ultimately, Syria pulled its troops out of Lebanon.

Sentence.sentence: We tend to think of the Depression as a time when families pulled together to survive huge job losses, By 1932.
Thank goodness, David pulled us out of the hole on that one.
